p: Because classic NT models only consider tabular and continuous data, critical geographical features –which may be fragmented or discontinuous– may be missed. Such features can be measured by the bio-geo-temporal approach which, it addition, can estimate both directionality (not measured by SS models) and low- and high-scale geographical variables (not measured by NT models). Because the bio-geo-temporal model also revealed disease clusters with outbound flows, earlier views on disease clusters, which assume disease clusters are only recipients of infective flows [68], could be revised.
